Article Text:
(Image via Instagram: Cardi B with her baby boy)

Cardi B Turns Her Umbilical Cord Into GOLD!

More coverage on Cardi B and Stefon Diggs:

The placenta forms an extraordinary bond between mother and child, with the umbilical cord as their lifeline of silent conversation. When the baby arrives, the placenta follows, marking the end of this quiet connection. For nine months, mother and baby shared unspoken messages through this remarkable link, only to part with it at birth. But what if that connection could last a lifetime? That is probably the vision behind Mommy Made Encapsulation, a service that allows mothers to preserve their placenta forever. Such preservation was chosen by Cardi B , partner of New England Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs The couple recently welcomed a baby boy into their lives. Following the heartfelt tradition, she began with her third child, daughter Blossom, in October 2024, the Grammy-winning rapper chose to honor her fourth child with Diggs in November 2025 in a similar way. She entrusted Mommy Made Encapsulation to transform her pregnancy journey into cherished keepsakes, capturing the memorable moments when her baby was still growing inside her. The company crafted a heart-shaped gold pendant from the baby‚Äôs umbilical cord and turned the placenta into nourishing vitamins to support her post-partum recovery.Curious about how the gold pendant comes to life? The process begins with careful cleaning of the placenta, followed by a wash with blue dye that highlights its unique texture.After another rinse, the technician gently separates the placenta from the umbilical cord. The cord, now a striking blue, is shaped around a heart-shaped metal ring, with any extra length trimmed away. Finally, the piece is dipped in shimmering gold chrome, transforming it into a gleaming keepsake. The company describes it as a way to honor the first bond between mother and child. According to the company‚Äôs website, ‚ÄúThe umbilical cord keepsake is your baby‚Äôs umbilical cord dehydrated in the shape of a heart and then dipped in gold chrome. The end result looks and feels like metal and is the perfect way to honor the first connection you shared with your baby.‚Äù It costs $50.The ‚ÄúAM I THE DRAMA?‚Äù creator took things a step further by having her placenta turned into vitamin capsules. That‚Äôs not all. She also tried something called a Placenta Print. The process starts with cleaning the placenta and dyeing it blue to look like a tree. Then, a sheet of paper is pressed on top to make the company‚Äôs signature Placenta Print, which costs $65. Their website explains that the print is made by painting the placenta with food-grade coloring (one gets to choose the colors) and stamping it onto a 12-by-18-inch poster to create a Tree of Life painting. After the print is made, the placenta receives a fresh rinse before its transformation into capsules begins. Lemon juice, cayenne pepper, and ginger are added to the raw placenta.The website explains that the Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) method is used, with careful steaming at 220 degrees F for 30 minutes to ensure safety. Bacteria and viruses cannot survive at temperatures higher than 131 degrees F. The placenta is gently steamed in specially designed steaming bags made up of heat-resistant, FDA-approved nylon, safe for cooking and free of BPA. Once steamed, the placenta is dried, ground into a fine powder, and sealed into capsules.Each placenta yields 160-180 pills, which, when taken regularly, can offer many benefits for new mothers, such as increased energy levels, reduced post-natal bleeding, lesser chance of baby blues, balanced mood and hormone levels, increased milk supply, lesser chance of post-partum depression, higher iron levels, uterus returning back to pre-pregnancy size faster, losing baby weight faster, and enhanced bonding experience with the baby.The capsules are available in a variety of flavors, including strawberry, orange, bubblegum, lime, berry, grape, and a vegan option. According to the website, these capsules never expire. They just need to be kept at room temperature and in a dry place. The pills can be taken with other medications. The cost of encapsulation starts at $500. This never-heard-before ritual has even captured the curiosity of stars like Megan Fox and Vanessa Hudgens , who, like Cardi B, have embraced the trend of creating placenta keepsakes.Mommy Made Encapsulation was founded by mother-of-four Juliane Corona in 2016. Juliane and her team have encapsulated for over 40,000 moms, including celebrity clients such as Brittany Nassif, Jacqie Rivera, Leslie Hernandez, Adizia Benzon, Andrea Espada, Brittani Boren, and more.
Article Summary: The Grammy-winning rapper entrusted Mommy Made Encapsulation to transform her pregnancy journey into cherished keepsakes. The company crafted a heart-shaped gold pendant from the baby‚Äôs umbilical cord and turned the placenta into nourishing vitamins to support her post-partum recovery.

There is something magical about rediscovering an old, worn photograph. The soft yellows, the creases, the fading edges and the stubborn scratches hold stories that feel too precious to lose. Whether you are working with a family album or a treasured vintage snapshot, this tool gives you professional level results with far less effort.Google Nano Banana Pro uses advanced diffusion modelling and context-aware reconstruction. In simple terms, it analyses each pixel, predicts missing details and rebuilds textures so the restored image looks authentic rather than overly sharpened. It also understands lighting, skin tones, shadows and colour balance, which makes it one of the most reliable tools for repairing vintage portraits. Instead of plastic-looking edits, you get subtle, human-like restoration that respects the original photo.The model also handles very damaged images. Torn edges, fold marks, grainy patches and faded backgrounds can be reconstructed automatically. For photos from the 70s and 80s, which often have tinted colour casts, the tool balances hues without making the image look artificial.Using this model effectively comes down to guiding it with clear prompts. This causes incorrect smoothing, unnatural facial features or oddly bright colours. Another mistake is using portrait prompts for landscape images, which can distort objects. Over-sharpening is also common, resulting in a digital rather than vintage look. Always compare the original and restored versions side by side to ensure the emotional tone remains the same. This helps you refine edits, preserve important details, and maintain the original atmosphere that gives the photograph its distinctive authenticity.Photo restoration is more than fixing pixels. It is a way of honouring memories that might otherwise fade. With Google Nano Banana Pro and the right prompt strategy, you can bring old pictures back to life while preserving their history and charm. A few careful edits and a well-structured prompt are often all it takes to rebuild details, refresh colours and revive treasured moments. If you have a box of old photographs waiting to be restored, this tool is a gentle and precise way to begin.

Article Title: Warren Buffett‚Äôs $4.3 billion Alphabet investment signals a direct challenge to Nvidia‚Äôs lead in AI chips
Article Text:
Google‚Äôs AI chips may be shifting the balance of power

Nvidia Makes History: First Company to Hit $4 Trillion Market Cap

A shifting competitive dynamic, but not a dethroning

Google trains and serves Gemini models on TPU infrastructure.

Companies such as Anthropic have announced plans to use up to one million Google TPUs, citing performance and cost considerations.

What Buffett‚Äôs investment likely signals

Implications for the AI chip race





When Berkshire Hathaway revealed a new multibillion-dollar stake in Alphabet, most observers initially viewed it as another major addition to Warren Buffett‚Äôs long-term portfolio. Yet the timing and strategic context suggest the investment could be more than a routine allocation. The world‚Äôs most influential value investor has chosen to back Alphabet at a moment when the company is strengthening its control over the hardware that underpins advanced AI systems.For nearly a decade, Alphabet has been developing its own artificial intelligence chips, known as Tensor Processing Units (TPUs). In November 2025, the company announced general availability of its seventh-generation Ironwood TPU, describing it as designed for demanding AI workloads, including large-scale model training and high-volume inference. This announcement was made publicly on Google Cloud‚Äôs official blog, where the company highlighted lower costs and improved performance for AI developers.Most AI labs still rely heavily on Nvidia‚Äôs high-performance GPUs.These GPUs remain the industry‚Äôs gold standard, but they are extremely expensive and often in short supply. This has created bottlenecks for AI companies that depend entirely on Nvidia for compute capacity.Google is in a unique position. By designing its own chips, running its own data centres and integrating its hardware into products such as Gemini and Google Cloud, Alphabet gains levels of efficiency that many competitors cannot match without years of hardware investment. Analysts and industry researchers have suggested that TPU-based training may offer meaningful cost advantages compared to traditional GPU-heavy infrastructure, although exact ratios vary and are not always publicly disclosed.Buffett‚Äôs investment therefore can be understood not as a claim that Alphabet has overtaken Nvidia, but as confidence in Alphabet‚Äôs vertically integrated approach to AI. By controlling more of the stack, Alphabet potentially insulates itself from the price swings, supply constraints and dependence that characterise the GPU market.Nvidia remains the clear leader in AI chips and maintains a robust ecosystem of developers, tools and software support. Google‚Äôs TPUs represent a serious alternative in some workloads, but not a full replacement for GPUs across all use cases.The publicly available evidence shows:These developments suggest that the AI compute market may become more competitive. However, they do not confirm that Nvidia‚Äôs dominance is definitively weakened. Instead, they indicate that Alphabet is emerging as a strong hardware contender in a market previously dominated by a single supplier.Berkshire Hathaway‚Äôs disclosed stake in Alphabet was valued at approximately US$4.3 billion at the time of the filing. The filing does not state Berkshire‚Äôs motives. However, investors and analysts widely agree that Buffett‚Äôs approval of such a large position indicates confidence in Alphabet‚Äôs long-term strategy, including its growing emphasis on efficient AI infrastructure.Buffett has consistently favoured companies with durable advantages or ‚Äúmoats.‚Äù Alphabet‚Äôs traditional moats have included Search, YouTube and Android. In the AI era, Google‚Äôs control over its own chip design and cloud hardware may represent an additional moat that differentiates it from rivals.This does not imply that Google is attempting to dismantle Nvidia‚Äôs leadership. Instead, it suggests that Alphabet is building the capability to operate more independently in an AI-driven future, and that this capability may strengthen its competitiveness in cloud computing and AI services.The next phase of AI is likely to be shaped by which companies can train and deploy models most efficiently. If Google Cloud attracts more third-party training due to cost, performance and availability, it could gradually shift cloud market dynamics. Nvidia will remain central to the ecosystem, but Google‚Äôs TPU ecosystem adds a new dimension to the competition.Buffett‚Äôs investment amplifies the narrative that companies with deeper control over hardware, software and data will hold significant advantages in the years ahead. Alphabet is signalling that it intends to be such a company.The takeaway is clear: this is not the end of Nvidia‚Äôs dominance, but it may be the beginning of a more competitive era in AI hardware.
Article Summary: Alphabet has been developing its own artificial intelligence chips, known as Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) In November 2025, the company announced general availability of its seventh-generation Ironwood TPU. By designing its own chips, running its own data centres and integrating its hardware into products such as Gemini and Google Cloud, Alphabet gains levels of efficiency that many competitors cannot match.

Article Title: Microsoft: Tech Layoffs: Layoffs at Microsoft, Meta, Google, Twitter: What is 'career cushioning' and why it's important
Article Text:
As job cuts continue to rise in various industries, some employees are going for 'career cushioning'.

Q: What is career cushioning?

NEW DELHI: Microsoft Corp is reportedly planning to cut thousands of jobs, with some roles expected to be eliminated in the human resources and engineering divisions, according to media reports on Tuesday.This move follows similar job cuts announced by other tech companies, such as Amazon, Meta Platforms , Twitter, Google , Salesforce and a host of other corporations.These job cuts are being attributed to slowing demand and a worsening global economic outlook. The move by Microsoft indicates that the tech sector may continue to shed jobs in the coming months.As job cuts continue to rise in tech and various other industries, some employees are choosing to proactively seek out new job opportunities while still employed. This strategy, referred to as " career cushioning ". Here is all you need to know on 'career cushioning'A: Career cushioning refers to the practice of building a diverse set of skills and experiences in order to make oneself more marketable and resilient to job loss or industry changes. This can include gaining experience in multiple areas of a field, developing a side hustle or passion project, or building a professional network.A: Career cushioning can help provide a sense of security and confidence in uncertain job markets and can also open up new opportunities for career advancement. It can also help you be better prepared if you do lose your job, making it easier to find new employment.A: There are several ways to begin career cushioning, such as:Building a diverse skill set through continuing education or volunteer workNetworking with professionals in your industry and other industriesBuilding a personal brand through social media and professional online presenceSaving money for unexpected career changes or job loss.A: Some examples of career cushioning include:-A software developer taking on freelance web design projects to gain experience in user interface design.-A marketing professional starting a blog to gain experience in content creation.-A sales representative taking on additional responsibilities in product development to gain experience in product management.A: No, career cushioning is applicable for people in any industry. It's about being proactive in preparing for potential changes in your career, regardless of the industry you're in.A: It's a good idea to review your career cushioning efforts regularly, perhaps once or twice a year. This will allow you to assess your progress and make any necessary adjustments to your plans. Additionally, keeping an eye on the job market and industry trends can help you anticipate and prepare for any potential changes in your field.A: You can gauge the effectiveness of your career cushioning efforts by monitoring your progress in gaining new skills and experiences, as well as the feedback you receive from your professional network and potential employers. Additionally, you may find that you are better able to adapt to changes in your industry, or that you have more opportunities available to you.A: The amount of time you should dedicate to career cushioning will depend on your individual goals and circumstances, however it's important to balance the time you spend career cushioning with your other responsibilities. A good rule of thumb is to spend some time each week or month working on career cushioning activities, but not to the point that it negatively impacts other areas of your life.

Article Title: About this Account: How Twitter's new feature exposed trolls 'manufacturing consent'
Article Text:
AI Image generated by Gemini

The moment the masks slipped





TOI Graphics

Manufacturing dissent

Manufacturing Consent broke ‚Äî now we manufacture personas





VPNs: the Hydra that learns faster than Musk





AI image generated by Gemini

The internet as a global masquerade





AI image generated by Gemini

Are you not entertained?









One of the strange things about the Epstein revelations is how true the reality turns out to be to the imagined conspiracy theory that the world is ruled by a bunch of global elites who are always in charge irrespective of who wins democratic elections. Epstein‚Äôs mailing list suggests that America‚Äôs true pastime wasn‚Äôt baseball, football or even trolling, but hanging out with Jeffrey Epstein . From Donald Trump to Woody Allen, everyone seems to have been close friends with Jeffrey Epstein. Even Noam Chomsky, the world‚Äôs most pre-eminent public intellectual, thanked Epstein for explaining the ‚Äúintricacies of the global financial system‚Äù in a way the ‚Äúbusiness press and professional journals‚Äù hadn‚Äôt been able to do.It would appear that the man who penned Manufacturing Consent was infatuated with Epstein, who was manufacturing consent in his own way. Speaking of manufacturing consent, recent updates from X suggest that there‚Äôs an entire industry which has taken over from mainstream media when it comes to shaping narratives. Much like we saw in James Gunn‚Äôs Superman, there is an actual farm of monkeys trolling people online. That‚Äôs not a surprise to anyone who is online and opinionated and has faced numerous brickbats from political fans, cricket fans, dog lovers and the occasional Grammar Nazi.That troll farms existed was fairly well-known but even WH Auden would be surprised to learn that many prominent Twitter accounts are run by farms. And we saw that when Elon Musk‚Äôs X (the hellhole known firmly as Twitter) rolled out its ‚ÄúAbout this Account‚Äù location panel and suddenly the most ardent patriots found their geotags betraying them. Proud American constitutionalists were from Nigeria or Western Europe, Europeans were proudly flying the MAGA flag, and Gaza fans were pegged in East Asia.The chaos began with a small icon Musk probably assumed would be a cute transparency feature. Instead, it detonated the timeline. For years, people fought with strangers online under the illusion that these strangers lived nearby. That illusion collapsed the moment the map pin dropped. Suddenly, timelines were littered with patriots tweeting from Ankara, Gaza reporters posting from Krakow, and Ivanka Trump megafans tapping away from a quiet suburb in Lagos.The feature exposed not just hypocrisy but the architecture of online politics ‚Äì the globalised supply chain of outrage that most users never realised they were participating in. Sort of like the dead internet theory but on another whole leve.Thousands of Americans believed they were arguing with fellow citizens; they were, in fact, sparring with accounts run by people who don‚Äôt vote in their elections, don‚Äôt live in their society, and don‚Äôt care about their policies beyond the dopamine of engagement metrics. And because nothing in 2025 happens quietly, the most exposed accounts weren‚Äôt marginal. They were celebrities in their ideological microcosms.The patriots posting from everywhere except America The parade of revelations had the comic timing of a farce. The self-declared ‚Äúethnically American constitutionalist‚Äù account @1776General_ was found tapping away from Turkey. @AmericanVoice__, a 200,000-follower ‚Äúvoice of the people‚Äù, appeared to be run from South Asia before vanishing in the world‚Äôs fastest guilty deletion. MAGANationX, roughly 400,000 followers, lived comfortably in Eastern Europe.IvankaNews, with nearly a million followers, was unmasked as tweeting from Nigeria ‚Äî which explains the unlimited energy but not the obsession with Ivanka‚Äôs potential political career. Then there were the medium-sized troublemakers: DarkMaga tweeting from Thailand, MAGA Scope broadcasting MAGA love from Nigeria, and MAGA Beacon lighting its patriotic lamp from South Asia.Suddenly, the American culture war looked less like a national debate and more like a global business process outsourcing unit. Patriotism had become a franchise. Even the Founding Fathers would be confused ‚Äî not at the propaganda, but at the sheer international enthusiasm for it. Gaza influencers and the geography that didn‚Äôt add up Gaza-aligned accounts faced their own meltdown. The ‚ÄúGaza-based journalist‚Äù @AbujomaaGaza seemed to be posting from Poland. Quds News Network, via @QudsNen, showed up in Egypt. And the massively influential Times of Gaza was flagged somewhere in the wide, ambiguous region of East Asia.These revelations didn‚Äôt discredit the broader cause, but they did highlight how deeply online narratives depend on the illusion of proximity. People wanted to believe they were reading from the frontlines, not from stable WiFi three time zones away. The map pin didn‚Äôt reveal deception as much as it revealed desire ‚Äî the public‚Äôs longing for authenticity, even when it is manufactured.Meanwhile, the troll-factory isn‚Äôt confined to one border. Multiple investigations and academic studies have shown how Pakistan-based networks routinely impersonate Indian users to manufacture dissent and amplify domestic polarisation. Researchers have traced coordinated behaviour in which clusters of accounts adopt Indian names, stock profile photos, and patriotic bios to blend into Indian conversation spaces ‚Äî only to switch, en masse, into communal outrage or anti-India propaganda during sensitive moments.During recent flashpoints, these networks circulated recycled riot footage, AI-edited images, and scripted slogans copied across hundreds of handles in seconds. The entire operation works like a psychological supply chain: fake Indian voices generating fake Indian anger to provoke real Indian reactions. The operators remain invisible, the identities disposable, and both dissent and nationalism become export products in a cross-border influence industry.This is where Herman and Chomsky accidentally predicted 2025, though not in the way their disciples imagine. Manufacturing Consent didn‚Äôt argue that the media brainwashes people. It argued that media institutions, through structural filters ‚Äî ownership, advertising, reliance on official sources, ideological framing ‚Äî quietly set the boundaries of legitimate discourse. Citizens weren‚Äôt forced into opinions. They were nudged into predictable lanes.But the internet has mutated that model beyond recognition. In the old world, institutions manufactured consent. In our world, anonymous operators manufacture identities.The propaganda model went from an elite system shaping news coverage to a chaotic free-for-all where anyone with a smartphone and a VPN can manufacture an entire persona: patriot from Ankara or an activist from Krakow or a conflict reported from Manila.The product is illusion, the geography is veneer and truth is obviously optional. The terrifying brilliance of 2025 is that consent is no longer manufactured through editorial agendas but through character creation. These accounts don‚Äôt persuade because they are credible. They persuade because they feel authentic ‚Äî right up until the map pin exposes them.Predictably, the moment the feature launched, VPN usage shot up like a cryptocurrency during a pump-and-dump. Troll farms upgraded from cheap servers to premium residential proxies. IPs rotated. New envelopes of suspicion appeared on profiles. People joked that the VPN detection icon looked like a scarlet letter for the post-truth era. But the truth is simple: there is no technical fix for a philosophical problem. We cannot patch authenticity. We cannot geolocate sincerity. We cannot trace truth to an IP address.The trolls didn‚Äôt disappear. They simply changed masks.People reacted with shock, but they shouldn‚Äôt have. The internet has always been a masquerade. In 1993, the joke was ‚ÄúOn the internet, nobody knows you‚Äôre a dog.‚Äù In 2025, the joke is ‚ÄúOn the internet, your dog might be running a MAGA page from Lagos and a Gaza activism account from Krakow simultaneously.‚ÄùWhat the map pin revealed is that people had mistaken masks for faces. They thought avatars were reflections, bios were confessions, and tweets were testimonies. Instead, they were reading carefully engineered performances by people who realised long ago that political identity is just another online aesthetic, like filters or fonts.The location feature will not save X. It will not bring back trust. It will not cleanse the platform‚Äôs ideological sewer. But for a brief moment, it acted like a cheap blacklight in a dodgy hotel ‚Äî illuminating stains people pretended not to see.It reminded the public that the loudest voices online may not live anywhere near the cause they champion, the ideology they promote, or the country they claim to defend.It showed that the global culture wars are not confined to borders. They are products exported like any other commodity.And it left us with a simple lesson: the internet will never tell you who someone is. It will only tell you who they want you to believe they are. The masks are still on. The performances continue. And the trolls, wherever they actually live, are still logging in.For years, establishment media pretended to be the custodian of civilised debate, the velvet-rope bouncer deciding who entered the conversation and who remained outside with the smokers. Social media was supposed to smash that order. Broadband arrived, timelines bloomed, and suddenly everyone ‚Äî from retired engineers to conspiracy sommeliers ‚Äî could shout with equal volume. The old guard insisted the ‚Äúguardrails were gone‚Äù, as if democracy had suddenly become too democratic for their liking.But that dismantling was never quite what it looked like. The elites didn‚Äôt lose power; they simply lost exclusivity. The gatekeepers vanished, and in their place rose something far more chaotic: algorithmic outrage, Populism-as-a-Service, and armies of personas manufactured from laptops in Lagos, Krakow and Bangkok. The crowd may have taken the stage, but the script was still being written elsewhere.And this is where the twist lands hardest. Chomsky warned that elite institutions shaped our consent. What he didn‚Äôt foresee was that, once the old filters collapsed, consent wouldn‚Äôt become freer ‚Äî it would become fragmented, exported, and crowdsourced through troll farms wearing the masks of patriots and activists. The establishment didn‚Äôt lose control to the masses. It lost control to the performance of the masses, often staged from thousands of miles away.The guardrails didn‚Äôt fall. They were just replaced ‚Äî and like all great empires, the replacements point back to Rome. A place where spectacle always trumped sincerity, where the crowd‚Äôs roar drowned out the truth, and where Maximus was murdered to preserve the illusion of order. In 2025, consent dies the same way ‚Äî not with censorship, but with performance.
Article Summary: Jeffrey Epstein's mailing list suggests that America‚Äôs true pastime wasn‚Äôt baseball, football or even trolling, but hanging out with Jeffrey Epstein. From Donald Trump to Woody Allen, everyone seems to have been close friends with Epstein. There is an entire industry which has taken over from mainstream media when it comes to shaping narratives. Much like we saw in James Gunn's Superman, there is an actual farm of monkeys trolling people online.

Article Title: what will train travel on Indian Railways look like in 2026?
Article Text:
With Vande Bharat sleeper trains, newer versions of Amrit Bharat Express, passengers can hope for better travel experience in the coming years.

What trains can passengers look forward to in the coming years? What will be the features of these trains and rollout timelines? We explore:

Vande Bharat Sleeper Trains

PM Modi Flags Off Four Vande Bharat Express Trains From Varanasi, Says ‚ÄòNew India On Fast Track‚Äô

Vande Bharat Sleeper

What are the expected features of the Vande Bharat sleeper train?

The first prototype of the Vande Bharat sleeper train has 16 passenger coaches - this includes 11 AC 3 tier coaches, 4 AC 2 tier coaches, and one AC First class coach.

The new train is capable of running at 160 kmph (testing speed 180 kmph) making it a semi-high speed train. However, most stretches on the Indian Railways network do not allow for such high train speeds.

Taking inspiration from European trains, the Vande Bharat sleeper train will have cushioned berths with enhanced comfort. The upper berth access has been redesigned for easier climbing.

The new train will have special night lights, integrated announcement systems with visual displays, CCTVs, and modular pantry units.

The train will feature modern bio-vacuum toilets, similar to those is aircrafts. There will also be a toilet for disabled passengers, which will also have a baby care station. The AC First class will include shower facilities with hot water provision.

The Vande Bharat sleeper train is equipped with the indigenous KAVACH anti-collision system. Like the chair car versions, the sleeper variant makes use of regenerative braking technology for optimal energy usage.

The coaches have automatic interconnecting doors. The gangways are sealed completely to maintain clean air and effective temperature control.

Each coach has individual reading lights, charging points, refreshment tables, and GFRP panel interiors. The train doors open automatically at the designated station.

The train has a Centralised Coach Monitoring System. Emergency communication systems connect passengers with the driver.

Vande Bharat Sleeper AC 1st

Vande Bharat Sleeper Kinet design

Amrit Bharat Trains For Common Man

Amrit Bharat Express

Foldable Snack table, improved Seats & berths, streamlined-LED light fitting, Fans with sleek SS grills

Air spring suspension bogies, Public Address & Passenger Information System (PAPIS), Mobile holder, Radium Illuminated flooring strip, Toilet Indication light

Aerosol-based fire suppression system in toilets and electrical cubicles, Foldable bottle holder, Sealed Gangway (Vestibule), Automatic-soap dispenser

Mobile charging socket for each passenger, Improved interior panelling with Aluminium Composite Panels

Semi-automatic couplers instead of semi-permanent for easy attachment and detachment

Crashworthy features, Electro pneumatic assisted brake system for quick brake application

Fully sealed gangway for quick coupling & decoupling, Vacuum evacuation system similar to Vande Bharat

Best in class toilets for maintenance friendly & better aesthetics, Automatic hygiene odour control system in FRP Modular toilet

External emergency lights to provide basic lighting during emergency situations, Charging sockets USB A & C type ports

NaMo Bharat trains, bullet trains & hydrogen

Some of the major features of NaMo Bharat trains are:

Fully Air Conditioned train, Fully sealed wider gangway, Centrally Controlled Double leaf Automatic Plug Doors, Electro Pneumatic Braking and Regenerative Braking System

20.32 T axle Bolster less Bogie ‚Äì Fully suspended Traction motor

Passenger information & infotainment system, Disaster lights for lighting during power failures, Train Control & Monitoring system, Continuous LED lighting

FRP Modular toilets with Vacuum Assisted Bio-toilet. PRM toilet in DTC, CCTV

NaMo Bharat train

first hydrogen-cell powered train

Hydrogen train

India is also looking to manufacture its own bullet train

Train travel in India is a vibe, with Indian Railways transporting millions of passengers. With the launch of the Vande Bharat Express trains a few years ago, Indian Railways has aimed to change the face of train travel, and several more new train projects are expected to deliver in 2026. While Vande Bharat - a chair car train set - has attempted to transform the day travel experience, there is growing demand for better and faster trains for overnight travel.In this regard, the Vande Bharat sleeper train project - launched a few years ago in the hope of rolling out an experience more premium than the Rajdhani Express trains - may prove to be a game changer. Simultaneously, Amrit Bharat Express and NaMo Bharat trains are expected to make travel more comfortable for the common man. India may also soon see its very own, indigenous bullet train Over 200 Vande Bharat sleeper trains are expected to be rolled out in the coming years as Indian Railways looks to revamp long-distance train travel. Three major projects are currently in the works: BEML is manufacturing 10 Vande Bharat sleeper train sets with the help of ICF; Indo-Russian joint venture Kinet has been tasked with rolling out 10 train sets; and a Titagarh-BHEL consortium will make 80 Vande Bharat sleeper trains.Additionally, ICF is also looking to roll out its own version of the Vande Bharat sleeper train soon.The first prototype of the Vande Bharat sleeper train project awarded to BEML was originally supposed to be ready in the first half of 2024. Several deadlines have since then been missed. Two prototype rakes have been manufactured by BEML. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has said that the Vande Bharat sleeper train requires 'minor' retrofitting. He believes that they will be launched in December.Sharing details about the Vande Bharat sleeper train projects, Integral Coach Factory (ICF) GM U Subba Rao told TOI, ‚ÄúInitially, we have given orders for 10 trains to BEML. The first prototype came out a few months back. We wanted some upgradations and improvements in the train so the second rake has come to us with the changes.‚Äù‚ÄúWe have already given BEML the go ahead for the other eight trains. The Railway Board will take the call on whether the two rakes will be launched together. From here on, BEML may manufacture one train a month,‚Äù he said.ICF too is looking to manufacture its own variant of the Vande Bharat sleeper. ‚ÄúWe are working on a 24 car rake, which will be one of the longest sleeper trains being produced in India. We are working on the designs. It is slightly different from what BEML has produced, because we are trying to increase the number of toilets since it‚Äôs a long-distance train,‚Äù U Subba Rao said.‚ÄúWe also plan to have a pantry car for food to be heated up and served, which is not available in the other version of Vande Bharat sleeper. So, the configuration is slightly different. We are also trying to improve upon the interiors‚Ä¶we are on the drawing board right now,‚Äù he added.So when does ICF plan to roll out its own version of the Vande Bharat sleeper train?‚ÄúMajor assemblies have been ordered. For example, the propulsion system has already been ordered, and other major assemblies like doors and brake systems, the tender is going to be floated anytime soon. Specifications have been kind of finalized. By December 2026 we are targeting that the prototype Vande Bharat sleeper rake should be ready,‚Äù he said.Meanwhile, Kinet recently unveiled the design of the First AC coach of the Vande Bharat sleeper train. The production is expected to begin at Indian Railways‚Äô Latur factory soon.Even as it launches a premium long-distance train, Indian Railways is also looking to introduce more modern trains for the common man. Amrit Bharat trains, first launched in 2023-end will continue to be introduced in the coming years as well. ICF is already rolling out Amrit Bharat 2.0 trains with better comforts compared to the first prototypes.Amrit Bharat Express is a push-pull train with non-AC coaches with a mix of general and second-class sleeper coaches. With a faster acceleration and deceleration, thanks to its push-pull technology, the Amrit Bharat train has a maximum speed of 130 kmph. In the coming months an Amrit Bharat 3.0 train is expected to be rolled out with AC coaches as well.ICF GM U Subba Rao told TOI that there is an order for 100 Amrit Bharat trains. ‚ÄúWe have got an order for 50 Amrit Bharat 2.0 trains and 50 more trains will be manufactured by RCF,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe have already produced 10-12 trains. Two rakes a month, we are producing right now,‚Äù he added.Talking about AC coaches for Amrit Bharat Express, he said, ‚ÄúWe are trying to introduce the Amrit Bharat 3.0 train as well. We have been asked to make five of those trains. We are working on the designs of the AC coaches. In this financial year, maybe by March 2026, we are trying to introduce the first prototype.‚Äù‚ÄúThe features will be similar to Rajdhani Express trains, but also much better because we also worked on non-AC coaches and made them better than the regular non-AC coaches. It‚Äôs an ongoing, continuous process,‚Äù he added.Several other projects that Indian Railways is working on include NaMo Bharat trains for short-distance inter-city travel, India‚Äôs own indigenous bullet train, and a hydrogen train which is a technology demonstrator project. NaMo Bharat trains, already launched on some routes, are a metro-style variant of the Vande Bharat Express trains, capable of 130 kmph speed.‚ÄúWe have produced one NaMo Bharat train, one was produced by RCF, Both are, right now, already in service. The board has decided that RCF will produce the balance 50 trains. We have already done the designing, and the design was shared with RCF, and they also produced the same design, they will continue with the production,‚Äù said ICF GM.Indian Railways has also manufactured its, which is expected to be launched soon on the Jind and Sonipat route in Haryana under the Northern Railway. The new train will have speeds of up to 110 kmph.Talking about the hydrogen train Subba Rao told TOI, ‚ÄúBasically this was a technology demonstrator. We tried to demonstrate the Indian capability of producing a hydrogen train. We will run it for some time and then maybe the government of India will take a call (on whether more such trains should be manufactured).‚Äù‚ÄúYou know, hydrogen technology is totally new. It's at an initial stage all over the world. So we are working on it. I'm sure it'll be successful,‚Äù he said.and a project has been awarded to BEML, in collaboration with ICF for manufacturing two high-speed train sets. The train will be indigenously designed and manufactured.‚ÄúHigh speed rail is being manufactured by BEML. We have given the order to BEML - ICF, NHRCL, and BEML are collaborating on that project. The preliminary designs are all ready. They are also finalizing the vendors for all the sub-assembles and all important components. Orders are also being placed,‚Äù Subba Rao shared.‚ÄúThe final designs will be done and once some components arrive the manufacturing of the prototype car body will start. By early 2027, the first train should be running,‚Äù he added.Talking about the India-specific features of the bullet train, the ICF GM said, ‚ÄúIt will be an air-conditioned chair car train suited for Indian conditions. Tropicalization has to be done. That's why designing the train within India is very important, since we know the conditions much better. In Europe, it is very cold, so they had to concentrate more on heating systems, whereas in India it is quite hot. So we have to concentrate on the AC system. PDAs can log in to the Jeevan Pramaan portal to view, verify, or download the certificate directly.Pensioners can also download a PDF copy of their certificate by visiting the Jeevan Pramaan website and entering their Pramaan ID or Aadhaar number. This ensures transparency and easy access for future reference.The government provides several options to submit the Life Certificate, allowing pensioners to choose the method that suits them best.Pensioners who prefer traditional methods can visit their bank branch or a Citizen Service Centre (CSC) to submit their Life Certificate physically. Pensioners can schedule an appointment, and an IPPB representative will visit their home to complete the submission using biometric authentication. By visiting https://jeevanpramaan.gov.in, pensioners can submit their Digital Life Certificate using a computer, laptop, or smartphone equipped with a fingerprint or iris scanner.The system uses the Aadhaar platform to authenticate biometric details. Key components of hallmark on gold jewellery



Gold, silver hallmarking : Gold and silver jewllery have long been treasured for their beauty and value. However, ensuring their purity and authenticity is important, especially in a market prone to fraudulent practices. This is where the hallmarking scheme comes into play. Here‚Äôs what you need to know about hallmarking charges and its procedures:Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver.It serves as a guarantee of their purity or fineness. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820, according to an ET report.Hallmarking charges are applied per article, regardless of its weight. For gold articles, the charge is Rs 45 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 200 for a consignment. Similarly, for silver articles, the charge is Rs 35 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 150 for a consignment. It's important to note that additional taxes and levies may apply.A consignment refers to a collection of articles with the same fineness, from which a sample is drawn and assayed for compliance. Different lots may exist within a consignment.Anyone can have their hallmarked jewellery tested for purity at an A&H centre by paying a testing fee of Rs. 200 (for testing using the fire assay method as per IS 1418). These centres must be recognized by the BIS. The list of recognized A&H centres is available on the BIS website under the hallmarking section.The primary objective of hallmarking is to safeguard consumers from counterfeit products. To achieve this, the Indian government made hallmarking mandatory for gold jewellery from June 16, 2021. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification ( HUID ) number.If you bought gold jewellery on or before June 30, 2021, it may have old hallmarking signs. These signs include the purity/fineness mark and the BIS emblem, along with two additional indications: the jeweller's identification number and the assay centre's mark/number.However, starting July 1, 2021, these two indications were replaced with a unique alphanumeric HUID code. The hallmark remains valid for the lifetime of the jewellery, and consumers can sell old jewellery, whether hallmarked or un-hallmarked, to jewellers.The HUID, or hallmark Unique Identification number, is a key component of hallmarking in gold jewellery. It's a unique six-digit alphanumeric code assigned to each hallmarked item, allowing for traceability. Customers can verify the HUID number using the 'Verify HUID' feature in the BIS Care App.Since the introduction of the HUID on July 1, 2021, the hallmark on gold jewellery consists of three marks: the BIS logo, the purity of the article in caratage and fineness, and a unique six-digit alphanumeric HUID number.
Article Summary: Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification number.
